subtitle: grief the raw truth
letting scotty go a mother's journey
through grief
now only god is watching scottie grow a
mother's journey through grief
by sandra clark acknowledgement
i would like to give special thanks to
kent carter
thank you for caring enough to turn your
vehicle around and investigating the
lights
you thought you saw dimly shine in the
wooded medium
thank you for staying with my son a
special thanks to rita hull my
sister-in-law who
reviewed and edited the manuscript and
more importantly was there for me in
time of need
thank you to all my friends who stood by
me through the long haul and you know
who you are
introduction if you are a grieving
parent
i must tell you this first you are going
to get better
this pain is not forever there is a
light at the end of this very dark
tunnel
in the beginning there is not one speck
of light or any hope or ever seen any
light
you are going to live again laugh again
and almost be yourself
but you will be different too i know
this is hard for you to believe at this
time
your soul has been wounded with the
deepest hurt of all hurts your child is
gone
i know everyone is different and
everyone grieves in his her own way
this book is my story to you as how i
survived losing my only son scotty
in the beginning i thought i could not
feel anything but pain and misery for
the rest of my life
this is the first attempt at writing a
book it may seem scrambled but this is
who i am
as the events came through my mind i put
them on paper
this book is for my heart and soul i
pray this book will help you
if you are a true friend of someone who
lost his or her child listening is the
best thing you can do
at first the parent may not want to talk
be patient
your friend may not be able to say
anything now they need someone to listen
they don't need anyone to judge them
it will be hard for you to listen
sometimes you'll get tired
you will think it is not getting better
but try to tough it out
you will have to be strong and you can
do it
you can walk away and take a break from
this your friend cannot
if you think you are having a hard time
how do you think your friend feels
the shock i could hear the pounding on
the door that got louder and louder that
cool november saturday morning it was so
early that i knew it was bad news
jeff my husband opened the door i could
see only the tip of the mississippi
highway patrolman's hat but i knew the
very instant i saw him that my son had
died
i have two daughters but i knew it was
my son i don't know why i knew i just
did
the patrolman asked for me i was backing
away instead of going toward him
i didn't want to speak to him because i
knew that when he told me the words you
would make it real
i froze and stared into his eyes as he
told me that michael scott had died
instantly on highway 49 south a few
miles from his home
the officer brought a pastor from a
local church with him
they stayed and talked to me and offered
help with contacting relatives or
anything else we needed
they also informed me that scotty's
father mike and his wife were the first
ones contacted because the accident was
so close to their home
the officer and the minister were kind
and sincere in their terrible task of
telling a mother her son had died
later i wrote a letter to the editor of
our local newspaper to thank both of
them for what they did that morning
after the officer and the minister left
the shock took over
i walked through my kitchen and through
my bedroom i looked at my three-year-old
grandson asleep in my bed
i went onto the utility room and turned
on the iron i got my grandson's clothes
and started ironing i told my husband i
had to be alone
i ironed the clothes i thought to myself
that this is not
really happening i knew where scotty was
jeff was consoling my 72 year old mother
i picked up the phone and called mrs
berry who was the grandmother of
scotty's lifelong best friend donovan
i remember asking miss berry if scotty
was there she said he wasn't i
told her i knew he was with donovan and
they were asleep in the front bedroom
she told me donovan was working in
tennessee and was not in his room
i asked her to please just go to luck
she came back to the phone and said
sandra he's not here then she asked why
i was out of bed so early
i told her about the patrolman coming
and how i felt sure he had made a
mistake and that scottie was at her
house she said
i'm coming over to your house
daylight the house was filled up with
people i took a washcloth and started
washing my face
people were talking making coffee and
the telephone was ringing constantly
i felt like i was watching a movie i
could see their mouths moving as they
talked to me but i felt far
far away i thought of scotty's wife
stacy and his father mike
i called him but stacy was the hospital
trying to get into the room where
scotty's body was being held
until the autopsy i talked to mike
he told me he asked the patrolman to
come and tell me about scotty
he said he could not do it he told me
the patrolman gave him scotty's jewelry
and he asked me what he should do with
it
i didn't even know what he was saying i
couldn't understand why someone even had
scotty's jewelry
we talked briefly in either knowing what
to say
we had been divorced for 19 years but we
had remained friends
everyone was still talking and trying to
make arrangements i was getting numb and
felt as if i were in a trance
i knew this was a horrible dream and
that scottie'd walk into the house any
minute
my dad had died 18 months earlier i
missed and loved my dad but for the
first time since he died i felt relieved
he was gone because i didn't have to
tell him that his only grandson had died
he loved scottie so much i am glad my
dad did not have to suffer the pain of
losing him
scotty was very close to his granddad
and he was very hurt when dad died
scotty and stacy went to the funeral
home with the family
when we went down to pick out the casket
scotty wanted my dad to be buried in a
beautiful but very expensive pine casket
we told him we didn't need that one
because dad would have the flag over his
casket because he was a world war ii
prisoner of war
he finally agreed on another casket the
same color as the car my dad had owned
and loved
scotty said but if i go you all better
get me this one
so when we went down to select scotty's
casket his wife and i went straight to
the one he'd actually picked for himself
the funeral cost was around six thousand
dollars i didn't have six thousand
dollars on that saturday morning
no way to get that much money my
daughter-in-law told me not to try to
get the money she paid for the funeral
with the money she and scotty had saved
for their house
i paid her back later because i felt i
needed to pay for my son's funeral
after the funeral arrangements were made
i asked my husband to take me to the
accident site
he resisted but he finally took me i saw
the orange paint on the road in a little
tree that stopped his truck
i got out and went to the tree the only
thing left was the glove compartment
lead line on the ground
i picked it up and looked at a tiny
splash of blood
i took it home and kept it i still felt
like i was in a dream
that evening it is saturday night and
everyone was gone
i am thinking there must be something
terribly wrong with me why am i not
crying why am i not screaming
they tell me my son is dead and i'm
staring into space i can't talk
i can't think straight and i feel so
strange i don't even miss my son i saw
his wife and dad today
they were the same as i they didn't talk
much they weren't crying
they were just kind of staring straight
ahead what is wrong with us
people must think we don't care then i
ask myself do you care
i go to bed and stare at the ceiling i
finally fall asleep and when i wake up
everyone is back in my house
sunday my three-month-old grandson is in
his carrier on my kitchen table
i stop and look at his tiny beautiful
face this was the same baby i love so
much now i look at him now with no
feeling
i don't want to hold him i walk past him
is always not there
i see my two daughters and i feel
nothing i am realizing i don't feel
anything for anyone in the world
my brother calls me from virginia trying
to console me he tells me he's getting a
flight as out as soon as possible
i tell him not to come that things will
be all right he said he would be there
after we hang up i think he shouldn't
come here i know he is so busy with his
work and family
why is he flying here i'm fine i have it
together
it looks like everyone else is more
upset than i am
why don't they just leave me alone
scotty's boss george moore a tall large
man has bent over my sink
weeping as others consoling him george
hired scotty as a plumbing assistant and
taught him everything about the business
george had a lot of patience with scotty
he treated him like his son
i go and get the pictures and give
george a photograph of scotty
i want george to feel better how can he
feel so bad and i feel nothing
he cries looking at the picture and i
don't
i try to see why everyone cries looking
at the picture all i see is scotty
it doesn't bother me at all to look at
the pictures i start thinking i must be
dead too
i tell george i don't know why scotty
was out so late and i didn't know where
he had been
when i say that the room is silent
george turns to me and through a broken
voice says
he was with me at my daughter's wedding
and i said oh that's good he was with
you
george looked so upset and sad i don't
understand
i know he would take care of scotty he
always looked after scotty scotty loved
him
i am grateful for all that george did
for scotty i trusted him i know it isn't
george's fault
scotty was a free spirit he would never
have gone to the wedding if they had not
wanted them to be there
there is food everywhere you look the
church just brought a load of paper
products and neighbor brings in bag
after bag of groceries
my supervisor brings a turkey i'm
wondering where i'm going to put all
this food
i fix my plate and eat just like always
there are so many people are talking
each other hugging me and praying
i finally feel something i need to go to
the emergency room
i won't go to sleep tonight i need to
ask a doctor for something to help me
sleep
i asked jeff to drive me there i realize
i'm holding three pictures of scotty
tightly in my hand
i sit in a room and i tell a doctor i
need something to sleep i tell him what
has happened
i tell him i just need to sleep a few
nights he gives me ten little pills
i go back home and finally everyone
leaves and i can go to sleep
monday i wake up monday morning and get
dressed and go to town i buy clothes for
my daughters and me to wear to the
funeral home
i walk to the counter and tell a lady i
need some shoes
i'm feeling panicky now i'm lost in the
store she asked me if i'm all right and
i tell her i lost my son
she says i'll call security how old is
he i say no he's not lost they say he
died saturday morning
she helps me and i leave the store and
go home
tonight i go to the funeral home to see
my scotty i walk and there he lies
his hair is combed so pretty his skin is
so tan and beautiful
his fingers look so thin his eyes are
closed i still feel nothing
i turn around to run on but i come back
i touch him but he's not real
then i touch his hair and that is where
my hand lay the rest of the night with
all the friends and relatives walk by to
see my beautiful boy sleeping
i make it through the wake and go home
to take my little pills and go to sleep
tuesday the next morning as i am seated
for the funeral i asked the funeral
director to let me go back and see
scotty one more time before they close
the casket
i stand and look at him i touch his face
and hair kiss him and tell him i love
him
i am still numb but something tells me
to see him one more time
i make it to the funeral with some
appearance of normality and i return
home
i take a single yellow rose and put it
in water by my kitchen sink
four and a half years later it's still
there
losing the shock it is the night of the
funeral everyone has gone from the house
i take the pill and go to sleep the next
day i clean my house and answer the
telephone all day
i take another little pill at night and
i go to sleep
i get up and start the next day i eat
breakfast clean the kitchen and decide i
need to mop the kitchen floor
i'm up half of the floor and stop it has
been five days since i was told scotty
died and i just realized my son is gone
i barely make it to the couch to sit i
start sinking i am sick to my stomach my
head is spinning
oh god scotty is gone
i look out the window i think oh scotty
oh god please let him pull up this truck
to eat lunch
the shock lasted five days reality is
set in
i feel the dagger slowly stabbing me in
my abdomen
the dagger is really a big tree limb the
stabbing end is pointed out at his
jagged edges
as if they broke it from a tree there
are many different edges to pierce my
body and mind
i feel a sharp edge penetrating me the
pain is indescribable
it hurts worse than anything i've ever
felt in my life
even now as i write this my breathing is
becoming labored because the pain is
something i can never forget
i start praying i think i'm dying for
sure
is this going to get better is this way
you feel forever when your child dies
i want to die to feel some relief i
cannot live like this
if i have to go through life like this i
don't want to live
the dagger pierces further i think if
the pain gets any stronger
maybe it will kill me death would be a
blessing
anything that will make this pain stop
and make this night where i go away is
acceptable
i think of other people who've lost
children how did they survive how did
they make it
now i'm waiting by the window i just
know scotty is going to come to my house
to eat lunch
i know i'll see his truck pull up and
he'll jump out with his lunch
he'll have church's chicken and he'll
throw the chicken box in my garbage like
i always see it when i got home from
work
if he knew i was home today he would
bring me some chicken too
i don't want to eat i don't want
anything i just want him to come home to
see me
this time i'll run out to the truck and
hold him and hug him and never let him
go
he won't understand but i will because
of this terrible lie people have told me
he'll say chill out mama
if he comes by today i won't let him go
back to work i'll have some money and
i'll give it all he
to him and he can stay with me here
oh god wouldn't it be wonderful when he
comes it's getting later and later
the phone is ringing and ringing i
didn't think he's going to make it today
then i remember he just threw his empty
chicken box an empty drink cup in my
garbage the other day
maybe they're still in the cans out
front i run outside and start going
through the garbage
why is there so much garbage oh yeah all
those people were at my house because
they thought scotty died
i hope the garbage men haven't picked up
since scotty was here
i can't find the box i can't find the
cup
i'm praying hard to let me find anything
he touched
if i could just hold the bones from the
chicken he ate i would have something to
maybe
take some of the pain away i never found
the box or the cup
no comfort zone there is no comfort zone
i feel as if i'm in a maze there's no
way to turn without running into an
obstacle
stacy scotty's wife comes over we can
hardly talk
she's looking for a husband and i'm
looking for my son
she can't help me and i can't help her
we can hardly even look at each other
seeing stacy makes it worse
i was so used to seeing her with scotty
she was his girlfriend since she was 13
years old
we both kept glancing around expecting
to walk in from another room
stacey has her hell to walk through from
losing the love of her life
i have my hell because my firstborn baby
my only son is gone
i didn't realize we could not help each
other i thought families clung together
but we just can't it seems so bad
we each withdraw into our own world with
grief
my younger brother billy comes and i
just sit and stare he does the same
there's no way to fake it it's too awful
it's too real
my other daughter miranda comes over
with my grandchildren
i still look at my grandchildren as i do
everyone else with no feeling toward
them
i try to talk to the children but i just
can't seem to say anything
nobody seems to be able to carry on even
a small conversation
it's been about 10 days and i'm sinking
further and further into this black hole
of grief i'm alone but it doesn't matter
it makes no difference whether someone
is here not
i wake up and stare at the ceiling it's
another day to try to get through
i stand up and make it to the middle of
my bedroom the dagger in my stomach is
going deeper and deeper i fold to my
knees and lay my head on my bed
i cannot get up there is no strength
left in my body
i pray that i will faint or die i just
have no fight left
there's just no way to bear this pain
anymore
my prayer for death is not answered but
my next prayer is
i take what little breath i have in my
body and i scream for god for scotty for
jesus
somebody please help me suddenly i felt
a warmth on my shoulder
i feel myself rising to my feet with no
problem
i walk out of the room with relief i
know i've been the closest to death
since scotty died
i just know that god sent someone to
help me i know he heard my cry maybe he
heard what some have called
the howl of grief that a mother cries
when she loses her child
the warm feeling left i want it to come
back i want to keep it but i guess it's
when you cannot bear the pain any longer
that you get help
i will never forget the warmth and love
i felt at that moment
thank you god
thanksgiving it is thanksgiving day it
has been two weeks since scotty died
scotty's paternal grandmother wanted
everyone in both families to have dinner
together
she was hurting but she threw herself
into her cooking to try to work out some
grief
she has faced trials and troubles in her
life but scotty's death has been her
hardest trial
we all go to the dinner she has worked
so very hard
food covers the dining room and kitchen
everyone is here but scotty
everyone is sad and the food is hardly
touched
stacy and i sit on the porch staring at
the sky we finally leave and go to
scotty's dad's house where she and
scotty were living
until they could build a house the land
had just been surveyed for the house two
weeks before scottie died
stacy falls asleep and i start to clean
the kitchen i keep cleaning i get down
on my hands and knees thinking
if i make everything perfect scotty will
come back
neither stacy no i ever open the door to
the bedroom neither of us can handle
that
she did go to the bedroom and smell his
cologne a few days later i went back and
got a dirty pair of jeans
and a shirt to smell and hold on to i
still have them and i know i always will
seeking help i'm out of the little pills
that gave me sleep
i know i can't take them anymore anyway
i had some medical tests run two weeks
before scottie died because i thought i
might have had a thyroid problem
i go back to get the results waiting for
the doctor to come in
and i am praying that she is going to
tell me i have terminal anything and i
will die
soon well all the tests are normal
i have lost 15 pounds because i only ate
when i was getting weak
i tell the doctor what has happened and
she offers me a night present
i'll never forget her saying if you take
them nothing will bother you
she went on to tell me how her daughter
became so difficult to live with last
year
because she was depressed about money
problems she said now her daughter
didn't care about much of anything
then she said let me go see if i have
any samples
that was my last visit i never went back
i was stunned
i thought how can there be a pill that
would make me never think about scotty
would not be horrible it was then and
there i knew i could not take anything
i knew i had to face it somehow some way
without medication
the doctor came back to the room with a
handful of samples and gave me a
prescription for more
i never took any of them and i never got
the prescription filled
as i drove home i thought if i take
medicine to get through this
i would stop or delay the grieving
process
i remember meeting a lady at a funeral
home who had lost her son she told me
don't take anything they fed me pills
for months and when i finally got off
the pills i had to face everything all
over
i'm not saying that some people don't
need medication i just knew it was not
something i could do
it had been three weeks since scotty
died i can't say for sure what i might
have taken that day i was in so much
pain
i was on the floor begging for help i
knew if i even started taking something
i would have to take it forever
i knew that eventually i would have to
be something stronger and stronger
i felt that this medication was going to
help me not care about scotty's death i
would not care about
anybody i don't know whether the
medication would have helped or hurt
i did not experience it there's one
thing i've learned
if you haven't experienced something for
yourself don't try to advise others
in this kind of tragedy you have to go
with what you feel is right for you
when we make mistakes we have to find
another route i know i made many
i went to a counselor she was 35 years
old she did not have any children
she was going to bring me a very good
book to our next appointment
it would help me she said i thought the
two days until her next appointment
would never pass
i was going to let look get some help
this book she was going to bring me
was going to be my miracle
two days later i finally got to sit down
in her office she started talking and i
was so anxious i couldn't be still
i finally interrupted and said did you
bring my book
she said oh i forgot it was if all life
went out of me
she went on talking i just sat there
stunned
when i left i knew i would never go back
i knew she did not have a clue as to how
i felt
i was so hurt so desperate that she
forgot i got the name of the book and
went straight to the bookstore
the book did not help
saved by the light the house is closing
in on me
no one can help me but me i am saying
the lord's prayer
psalm 23 and praying constantly to have
the strength to walk around
the kitchen floor is still half mopped i
won't let anyone finish cleaning it
it is though i'm holding out until
scotty comes home then i'll mop the
floor we'll have chicken mashed potatoes
dried lima beans and cornbread everyone
will come back to my house to see scotty
what a party that'll be it seems so long
since i have seen him
the movie saved by the light comes on
television
i have seen it before but this time i am
really interested in it
it is about daniel brinkley from aiken
south carolina
he had been struck by lightning and
pronounced dead for 28 minutes
he tells of where he ventured before he
came back to life the man that helped
daniel brinkley was dr raymond moody
i became very interested in dr moody i
immediately go out and buy the book
saved by the light
the book has much more information in
the movie next i buy moody's books
reunions and life after life
when it comes to going to buy something
to help me understand death i can get
dressed and get into the car and go
anywhere
i am desperate to hear anything about
the next life i want to know about the
place where scotty is living now
returning to work i can't stay at home
any longer
i have to go back to work i have to walk
through the door and face about 200
people
most of them know many were at the
funeral but it is one of the hardest
trials after scottie's death
i get up and look into the mirror my
hair is falling out in clumps
i had some gray before but now in only a
few weeks there are large white streaks
running through my hair
i have lost weight in my faces wrinkled
from losing weight so quickly
my face is in a mask-like stare of
sadness and grief
my eyes are so black underneath no
makeup can cover the circles
when i start to apply the base
foundation all i can see is the makeup
on scotty's face in the casket
with every move i make on my face i feel
i'm rubbing scotty's face
i'm 45 years old and i look 65.
i think well i surely don't care how i
look ever again
i make it to the job and i'm scared
nervous and still translate
even though reality is set in some
people try to mumble condolence and some
people are bold with their condolences
and some don't know
i'm repeating the lord's prayer in my
mind i'm praying i'm repeating the 23rd
psalm
i don't think i can take it some people
are sincerely sorry some people don't
want to look at me
they see the change the devastating
change
no jokes no laughter no nothing i'm just
a zombie
i can barely speak for fear of screaming
crying or fainting
and i've only been here for 45
then finally i make it to my workstation
what a relief there's my wonderful
friend linda crabtree
she and i have worked together for three
years and we know everything about each
other
i know when i finally make it to her
that i might be able to breathe and i
can
with linda i can do anything i can say
anything i want to say and she listens
i make it through the first day of work
i cry every break in the bathroom
after i cry my heart out i can make it a
little bit longer
after work i run to my car so i can
break down completely
i am slowly going into the guild stage
the guilt stage now i fully believe it
was my fault
i am taking all the blame for scotty's
death i have killed my son
i go back to the beginning if if if if i
had not divorced his dad
if we had not moved to another town if i
had been a better mother i torture
myself
i cannot understand why god would take
scotty and not me
i raised my children they are adults i
am not good for anything why
god why scotty i am the one who should
have died
scottie had so much to live for he loved
all your nature he loved walking in the
woods
he loved animals he loved growing
vegetables in the garden and he loved
your world
i live in a concrete world i can't grow
a plant and don't even have a pet
i don't want to walk in the woods i only
wanted to walk in department store
how could you take someone who loved
your world and leave someone who doesn't
oh i get it you left me here to suffer
this loss i'm so angry at god one minute
and then i'm down on my knees asking for
his help the next
i am controlled completely by the grief
by now i have another outlet guilt
it was my entire fault i was bad and god
took scotty as my punishment
i might as well have driven scotty into
the tree
i've already imagined the scene of the
wreck at least once an hour since it
happened
i can see scotty falling asleep merging
into the medium and then hear the loud
crash into the tree
where was i i was asleep in my bed while
my son
died they said he never woke up his dad
checked every piece of grass before he
hit the tree
he said he never hit the brakes how do
they know for sure
i don't know for sure anything but just
that it's all my fault
i wonder if the day if he was born if
they said okay you can have this baby
boy for 25 years and then we're taking
him back
i would have said yes i'll take him for
25 years
the day scotty was born changed my life
forever and when he died i thought my
life was surely over
how could i live on this earth without
my son there was not one reason i could
think of for my life to continue
i thought of my daughters and my
grandbabies i felt why should i go on
living for them
i'm no good for them if i don't get out
of this world someone else is going to
be taken from me
i was beating myself up so badly i was
losing an ounce of strength i might have
gotten back
real friends if you find you can't you
beat yourself up bad enough believe me
someone else is always there to help me
make you feel guilty if you don't have
caller id or peephole in your door get
it now
it didn't take long to figure this out
it's time to start weeding out the
so-called friends from the friends while
i was in shock i listened to phone call
after phone call from friends
i absorbed every word thinking any
minute one of them would say the magic
words that would make all this make
sense
i found that my real understanding
friends just listened
i know how hard this was for them now
but they did listen no matter what time
of day or night
i found out very quickly who was making
me feel worse and who made me feel
better
i soon just looked at the caller id and
chose who i talked to it helped me
some friends wanted to tell me why they
thought god did this to me
he's in a better place or god chosen for
a beautiful flower in heaven was no
comfort
i was thinking i wish you were in
another place instead of talking to me
some friends even agreed that it was my
fault
my friend at work linda suffered along
with me every day
we are very close friends and she could
feel my pain
i will never know how she had the
patience to deal with me
i wondered if i could ever have been as
good a friend to her as she had been to
me
she has the ability to look beyond the
reality and has no fear of the other
side
she never judged me on anything i said
to her i knew i could tell her anything
without her thinking i'd lost my mind
how hard it must have been for her to
hear me say i wanted to go to the
graveyard
dig him up and just touch him one more
time without linda i could never have
kept my job she had the courage to go
through this with me
i also worked with shirley johnson
another good friend and listener a few
hours a day
she was different from linda but she was
a true good friend
debbie holloman and lynn lofton were
good friends and listeners too i love
them all
now i must tell you about another
co-worker who made comparisons of my
losing my son to her dog that died
this one threw me like a knife i could
not even comment to think she could
compare my son to her dog
she had three children of her own i
finally chalked this up to ignorance
after working a couple of weeks the
grief still had 100 control
i felt i was the only one who hurt this
bad nobody had ever hurt worse
i went to a local support group seeking
help i still vividly remember a
conversation
with several of the members there when
one person mentioned to another that i
was still raw
in her own kind way she was saying that
she understood the pain for me was still
a much to bear
i will never forget that expression
at the support group i met a nice couple
roland and kay lightsley
they had lost their 17 year old son in a
drowning accident
until i met them i believe the mother
had to hurt worse than anyone did
we carried these babies in our bodies
and gave birth
i saw roland was just as devastated as
we mothers were
i went home and called scottie's dad we
had talked very little since scotty died
because we were both so alone in our
sorrow i can still hear his cry of grief
and despair
we were both devastated and could not
offer any help for each other
christmas season these few weeks have
led to christmas
i try to go to shopping mall i'm
overwhelmed i've not been in a store for
a while
people are everywhere shopping laughing
in a hurry i start looking at sunglasses
i want to cover my face
i feel it if i can put something over my
face i will feel better
sunglasses in december inside the store
might attract more attention
but i feel he'll help me somehow i don't
buy the glasses i just want to scream
don't you know my soul has died why are
you shopping why are you laughing
i am feeling so confused i give up i
can't take it i leave
i go home and call a few friends i ask
him to pray that i die
they argue and i tell him i can never be
their friend again i can't even function
i am nothing
i turn the telephone off and get on my
knees i beg god to please let me die
living is too painful there is no peace
i feel like i am in a maze
when i am home the walls close in on me
work is torture
leaving the house and being around
people is impossible
i drive 10 miles from my home to buy
groceries i don't want to see anyone i
know
if they mention scotty i'm upset if they
don't mention him i'm even more upset
what's this somehow i made it through
christmas
i'm still praying to die every night i
guess the only reason i didn't commit
suicide was the fear of not getting to
see scotty
but somewhere among all this confusion i
must have known that there was a reason
for me to go on living
it has been about six weeks since scotty
died i say my nightly prayer asking to
die
i go to bed and go to sleep i do not
wake up in bed
i wake up hovering over a bed looking
down at my husband my three-year-old
grandson and myself
i have no idea what has happened i float
over the bed looking down on me
then i see an arc way of light about six
feet tall between my dresser and
entertainment center
it is as bright as the sun but it is
white as snow
i am drawn to this like a magnet i am in
it like a flash
i feel peace i've never felt on this
earth before
it does not last long it fades away and
i wake up in my body
my first thought is is this how scotty
feels
oh god i hope it is i never wanted to
leave that light i wanted to stay
i don't know if i died that night left
my body or what but i know that the
light happened
the next morning my daughter-in-law
calls me she is at one of her lowest
points
i don't know how to help her i tell her
about the light in my room we both cry
after we hang out my heart is going out
to stacy
i'm not thinking of me now i'm thinking
of her i sit here on the bed and i say
scotty
i might be able to make it a little
while if you can help stacy
you can go to her i don't know why i
felt he was there but when i send him
away i hear a slight rustle like the
wind
but i feel a force pulling away from me
immediately i want him back i feel a
little different as if something i
really didn't understand happened last
night and today
researching death i wrote earlier about
reading saved by the light in every book
i could find by raymond moody
i really liked his reunions i'm very
interested in any book on near-death
experience
and now that scotty is gone i feel i
have to get in touch with anyone who's
had any death experience
for the first time in two months i'm
beginning to see a tiny tiny speck of
light in the huge dark tunnel of grief
my grief still has full control of me
but i have a goal
i have to research death i write letters
i make telephone calls
and i finally managed to make an
appointment with raymond moody for
august
he is in alabama not too far away from
my home in mississippi
i searched georgia south carolina and
tennessee only to find a few hours
find him a few hours away i feel august
is so far away but i have no choice
my brother john encouraged me to go see
dr mood he will pay for the trip and
appointment
my brother would do anything possible
for me to get better
i hear the train my feelings are
starting to return now i begin to feel
love for my children and grandsons again
i'm scared to love them i'm scared i'll
wake up and they'll be gone
now i have a new mission i've got to put
everyone i love in this giant bubble
i'll go to work and everyone else needs
to stay put because if something happens
to me it won't matter
but if the bubble pops every time my
daughter leaves i'm scared they're not
coming back
i'm babysitting my three-year-old
grandson carrie
climbs on my lap and he looks at me his
grandmother has changed so much her hair
is thin and streaked white she's so weak
she's so different sad and quiet he
looks at me and tells me mama
you don't love me anymore i assure him i
love him
i tell him i will get better i tell him
how now i can hear the trainings
like he does before scotty died carrie
and i would be playing outside and
sometimes inside
he would stop and stand still and say
mama i hear the train
i didn't hear it then now i always hear
the train
it's one of the loneliest sounds i've
ever heard even at night i wake up and
hear the train
february it's my birthday everyone is
here except scotty
thanksgiving christmas new year's your
past i feel so sad
i feel all my tiny bit of progress is
gone i'm going backwards my daughter
gave me a birthday party
we are all so sad this is my day my
birthday i'm supposed to get a call at
least from scotty
stacy tells me she has joined the
national guard she's leaving in march
for south carolina she can't live here
anymore
everything is changing my daughters have
had to grieve for their brother without
their mother
they lost their mother and brother on
the same day miranda my older daughter
faces me and says
mama billy and i are still here it is an
eye-opener but my grandson says it's
even more shocking
he is sitting in my bedroom with his
mother i walk to the kitchen and carry
asks his mother
where's mama miranda answered she's gone
right now
i walk back and i see his little sad
face ask his mother
and is she never coming back like scotty
i didn't think i could hurt for anyone
else but he broke what was left of my
heart
i finally felt all the love for him i
thought i'd never get back
that was one of my victories i could
feel love again
i was feeling again but i was getting
more paranoid about the possibility of
something else happening to my family
i would get sick when someone knocked on
the door the telephone rang
my heart felt like it was jumping out of
my chest until i realized nothing
was wrong if i was at work and the phone
rang it made me sick and scared
i would be so relieved that the call
wasn't for me
one day while i was home alone someone
knocked on my door when i started toward
the door it got stronger and louder i
started walking backwards
all the way to the utility room my heart
was pounding and i was so frightening
the knocking finally stopped and i
slowly walked the door and found a
package
i was so thankful i was so terrified
they had come to tell me somebody else
was gone
before stacey left for basic training
she wanted to order scotty's headstone
i wasn't interested i guess it seemed
final she talked to me and going with
her and she picked a jagged rock with a
scene of a stream with a deer
cost around two thousand dollars i
finally agreed and we split the cost
when i got it ready and set it up i
really felt good about it i felt he
would really like it because it was so
different
now stacy's leaving her home her friends
and her family for basic training
she's weak heard and so very sad she's
been running from the grief i look at
her with so many memories
i remember the first time i saw her i
thought she was such a beautiful little
girl and now a beautiful woman
she loved scotty with all her heart they
had many ups and downs but they grew up
and got married
stacy said it was the happiest day of
her life scotty was very happy
about six months before they got married
scotty suffered a brain hemorrhage it
frightened all of us
the surgery was in october that they
went ahead and married in august
the surgery was a success but scottie
could not work for 18 months
stacey worked in a jewelry store and
supported them and he was able to return
to work
i would stop by to see her at the
jewelry store she was always so
beautiful
her hands always look so pretty with her
beautiful fingernails and she was a good
salesperson
stacy had a hard time in basic training
she was grieving for scottie but trying
to keep up with the physical demands
we wrote each other and called every
chance we could she finally made it and
was able to graduate june 5th three days
before scotty's birthday
my friend rosemary and i drove to south
carolina to see her graduate
i did not realize what this was going to
do to stacey and me
i felt like i was doing all right until
we sat down to eat the night before
graduation
stacey was sitting across from me as she
lifted the fork i saw the beautiful
hands were covered with scratches and
scrapes
her fingernails were very short and
ragged with stain i looked at her face
and saw the girl who had aged 10 years
and 7 months
i could scarcely keep from bursting into
tears she was hurting my heart so badly
i didn't know she was feeling the same
i had to leave as soon as graduation is
over the closer i got to home the better
i felt stacey felt better after i left
too
the pain between us was just too much we
wanted to see each other more than
anything but when we did it was too
painful
it had been seven months i was better
this is hard to say but seeing stacy was
sending me backwards
i was so afraid i was going to be where
i was a few months ago
i now had control of my grief but i had
to get back to what now i was feeding as
a comfort zone
i will never know how my friend rosemary
made it through the trip it was awful
i wouldn't go to a restaurant no
shopping no nothing
i wouldn't leave the room after we got
the fort jackson i was so depressed
she must have been terrified of my
driving she never complained
that is a true friend she had to make a
lot of arrangements to go with me only
to have a terrible trip
raymond moody if you've ever read any of
raymond moody's books you'll know i
wanted to see him
i think that most parents would do
anything for just a minute with their
deceased child
i had a very positive day at dr moody's
home in alabama
i will never forget the experience we
talked all day about scotty death and
life after death
nine months had passed since scotty died
and i understood more about death
i remember telling dr moody that i was
coming to a conclusion we are all going
to die
i just never wanted to live long longer
than any of my children
it is the worst thing in the world to me
to bury your child i told him how i
blame myself for so many months because
i was such a bad person
i finally told dr moody estranged my
deepest guilt
before he died scottie called me at work
and asked me to go with him to a doctor
in jackson mississippi about a hundred
miles from our home
the appointment was for number fourteen
his wife was already having the
christmas rush the jewelry store and she
couldn't get time off
i asked scotty if you could change your
appointment because i was low on leave
i told him if he couldn't change it i
would go with him anyway
he called me back and asked me if i
could go on december 17th i checked my
supervisor and told scotty i could go on
december 17th
scotty was happy he wanted to go deer
hunting he was afraid that if he went to
a doctor they would find another
hemorrhage
he was terrified of the surgery again he
told me he'd rather die than wear that
metal halo for surgery again
when scotty died i felt so bad and
guilty why didn't i just go with him to
the doctor on november 14th
why did i let a job stand in my way if i
had gone maybe he wouldn't have been out
the next night
his wife felt as guilty as i did it took
a while to work through this guilt
but i know circumstances led us to a
different decision
we cannot see into the future i don't
know if scotty would be alive if we had
gone to the doctor november 14th
it was too late for what if i began to
think about a lot of different people
people
actually really bad but their children
were alive
i thought of elderly people who had died
without losing any of their children
some were good some weren't i realized
scotty had an accident he had gone too
long without sleep in a driven home
he was exhausted and fell asleep he died
in the world we know but he lives in the
other world
this is the only world we really know
when i go to that other world i will see
my son again
what a reunion that will be i no longer
feel i will never see him again i feel
in my heart for sure that we'll be
together
again i told dr moody of the dream i had
about scotty that was so real
scottie was standing by a huge body of
water the color of the water was the
most beautiful unusual blue
scotty's clothes were of a color i'd
never seen on earth he was older and he
was bigger
he looked at me and said mama i would
never come back there
i was disappointed i said you wouldn't
come back to me scotty
he said no not after being here it
bothered me at first but i know he is
somewhere so much better so much more
powerful in this world
he is happy i left dr moody's that day
feeling much better
he didn't have a magic potion that maybe
i felt better because i had
communicated my pain to a stranger no
holding back
after reading and researching more i am
learning i am different
i begin to realize how serious i am
becoming i am listening more than
talking as before
people's little problems seem so trivial
now i have experienced a real problem
the small stuff doesn't bother me
anymore
new york city i'm watching television
one day and see a lady
named rosemary altea she is a faith
healer from england she is also a medium
she is like the little boy in the movie
the sixth sense she can talk to dead
people
i go to the bookstore and buy her book
proud spirit
now i'm hooked with the help of friends
i get an address from miss altea
i write her letter asking if she will
ever be in the united states i want an
appointment
i want contact with scotty through her
she responds with a letter saying she
will not be in the us for two years
and that she is not taking any
appointments at this time
i'm disappointed i go to the spare
bedroom in my house and sit quietly
i tell scotty i want to see this lady so
much but that i can't
i tell him if it was meant for me to see
her i will hear from her
i ask him to help me i tell him it is up
to him now
two weeks later i get a letter saying
rosemary altea would be in new york city
in maine i can't believe it
i do not know how i'm going to do it but
i'm going to new york
that is a pretty big statement from
someone who's never been on an airplane
before hardly even been out of
mississippi
i've always been terrified of airplanes
but now i don't even think about my fair
flying
a good friend linda harrington wants to
go with me we plan our trip and all the
sites we are going to see while in new
york
i mailed the money for our tickets for
the workshop rosemary lt had explained
in her letter that she was only
conducting a workshop on healing
there would be no one-on-one
consultation i don't care
i know that if i can get there something
good is going to happen
we drive to new orleans to catch an
early saturday morning flight
when i look out the window of the
airplane and see the beautiful clouds i
think scotty i am close to you as i can
get
but i'm wrong we arrive in new york
around noon we shop we eat at wonderful
place so we finally fall asleep around 2
a.m
everyone seems so friendly and new york
city is beautiful i feel i'm in a fairy
tale
i think they like our southern drawl i
know we enjoy their accent
on sunday morning we walk a few blocks
to the marriott hotel for the workshop
as soon as i get off the elevator i feel
scotty's presence
i know without a doubt in my mind scotty
met me at the door
i tell my friends linda it's okay if i
don't get anything else today
i will be alright i walk into the
ballroom and take a seat
i think there are about 750 people or
the room is huge and every seat is
filled
rosemary is teaching relaxing exercise
color therapy and many other self-help
techniques
i think we have been here about two
hours when she stops and looks at one of
the guests and asks
does the name michael mean anything to
you the person responds and it doesn't
i know from reading and researching that
scotty could probably be called by his
first name michael
i do not get excited because there are
probably a lot of people associated with
the name michael
before she said michael i had been
sitting there praying silently
michael scott please get her attention
but i really wasn't sure it was him
i then begged him not to be shy and take
her over again
the point came when she had to say this
michael has got to leave me alone
i'm trying to do a seminar michael i
already knew he was here but i never
expected this
this is the book signing after the
workshop i wait to be the last in line i
actually
end up being third to last i think i can
ask her if she ever heard anyone from
michael and she does not know who he is
it is finally my turn in line and i give
my book to her to sign
as she takes the book i ask about
michael she looks up at me drops the
book stretches her left arm out
palm up comes down with her right hand
to make a loud clap
she says it was instant it was a crash
he wants you to know he had no trouble
crossing over the other side
he also wants you to know you are right
he is here with you i am so stunned i
can't remember whether her next
statement is
he looks like you or he's looking at you
i don't ask her to repeat it i've
received much more from the seminar than
i ever expected
i look at linda she is really crying
it really startled her for this woman to
know how my son died i looked at linda
and tell her
we won't talk about this today we'll
talk about it tomorrow it's just too
overwhelming and wonderful to discuss
today
scotty stays with me in new york we walk
in central park i say scotty
can you believe we had to meet in new
york city for a visit
setbacks the first year as hell but the
more i cry the stronger become
i have reached some level recovery now
on the first anniversary of scotty's
death i regress
i feel like the day the shock wore off
i'm so low i'm so scared i'm going back
to that raw
grief that dagger that had gone through
me is coming back
i set myself up for this pain through by
watching the movie selena
there's a true story about an
entertainer who died at an early age
after scottie died i remember asking him
one day if he'd ever seen selena
i've watched selena so much of my friend
k leitzy who owns a video store gave me
a copy
i think scotty's wife stacy looks so
much like selena
i love scotty so much i'm not claiming
he was a perfect child we had our ups
and downs
he almost drove me crazy sometimes he
could post some real stunts but he
finally grew up married stacy and settle
down
i think he was 23 when he brought me my
first real mother's day card from him
one he actually picked out bought and
gave to me i was stunned
before i always received a card but i
knew stacey had signed it for both of
them
i could not believe he had actually
grown up so much
another terrible setback occurs on the
day stacey and i pack
scotty's personal things i want to put
his things in boxes close them up and
store them as quickly as possible
i thought we could do it in about an
hour and leave i didn't want to look at
him
stacy takes every piece of clothing he
owned hugs it then folds and places each
piece neatly in the boxes
i sit on his bed holding a cigarette
butt that i knew it touched his lips
i feel i'm going back to the beginning
again we cry a lot but somehow
we managed to make it through the day
losing a child is so painful
i think of parents who have lost their
only child my biggest fear now
and i think it is the most bereaved
parent is to lose another child
i'm wiser now and understand death
better if it happened again
i would have the same grief because
they're my children
i grieved scotty the only way i knew i
died with him
but i was still breathing i felt they
buried me with him but they buried me
alive and i had to crawl out of this
grave
my daughters went through their grief in
different ways but they both have come
to terms with scottie's death
we loved him and he was worth every bit
of the pain
if we didn't love him so much the pain
would not have been so terrible
missing me about seven or eight months
after scottie died a friend
stopped to see me she looked at me
sitting there looking so haggard
she said to me sandra scotty was so
proud of you
he thought you were so pretty i know you
would never want you to look this way
i thought about it after she left i felt
i started caring about how i looked i'd
be selfish
if i looked better i might feel better
and i was so used to living with my
grief i didn't want to let it go
i was used to feeling this way and i was
scared to feel any other way she was
right though
i went out and had my hair cut and
colored i started eating healthier
my hair got thicker and felt stronger i
knew scotty would not want me to stay
sad i finally realized
i did not have to suffer to prove to
scotty that i loved him
he wanted me to get better he wanted me
to live he loved me too
it happened i wake up and scotty isn't
the first thing on my mind
perhaps a minute passes before i think
of him it scares me
i feel guilty and i'm ashamed i feel
like how could i have possibly forgotten
for one minute
it happens again for maybe two minutes
this time i make some changes i start
lying in bed five extra minutes
i talk to scotty every morning before i
get out of bed then i put him aside for
me and my other children
i think about him any time i want to but
i do not feel guilty anymore
i sit down and write a letter to scotty
i tell him how much i love him
i write of how i miss myself and through
all his grief i also realize
i am a person i apologize for the
mistakes i made as a parent i also tell
them
i did the best i could the choices i
made wrong the writer in the past
i write to scotty that i feel i need to
be a mother to his sisters and a
grandmother to my grandsons
i am not saying i'm over his death i'm
just learning to live with it i have no
choice
he is my heart soul body and mind and i
take him with me wherever i go
this is the only way i can have him now
i closed the letter and feel better i've
tried to write the letter before i
couldn't because it wasn't time
i finally stopped looking for him in
vehicles and i no longer think i see him
in places or look at closed form and
department stores it has taken me about
a year to get to this place
of course there will always be triggers
that will cause me to feel the raw pain
again for just a few minutes
i cry and get it on my system
i read an article about grief getting
caught up in the tissues of one's body
i can see how this could happen i think
the crying and the pain cleanses the
hurt from the tissues of the body
as i said before you grow accustomed to
the grief
it is all you know and you're scared to
let it go it controls you
you are convinced that if you get better
you didn't love your child enough
i'm just afraid some people will think i
didn't love him if i let go of my grief
people who have not been through this
can't even imagine the pain
before scottie died i remember feeling
sorry for people who lost their children
but i didn't really know what to say so
i just gave my condolences i went about
my life
i had no idea of the torture they went
through i know now
i am sorry that i wasn't more comfort to
my former neighbor when i lived in the
country
anita lost her son in an accident at the
time i didn't know what to do for
we weren't really friends just
acquaintances who talked when we saw
each other
when anita came to scottie's funeral i
remember looking at her and thinking
she's been here before i called her
after the shock and she called me
somehow i think we helped each other we
became very good friends
loss a good friend of mine mary heinbot
died unexpectedly six months before
scottie died
she was actually the mother of my
special friend rosemary
and she was more like a mother to me
than a friend she had helped me with all
of my problems since i was a young girl
she was good understanding patient lady
and when she died so suddenly it hurt me
she had lost her only son four years
earlier
i never knew what pain she must have
felt until i lost my own son i miss her
i know if she had been here when scottie
died she would have been by my side
there will always be setbacks seven
months after scotty died one of my
former supervisors lost his daughter
she was in an accident a few weeks
before scotty had been in a coma since
then
i had prayed for her and her family i
never met her but when she died everyone
at work was notified
i started going backwards that day at
work her death set me back so much
i knew the parents and i knew they were
a loving family
i don't know if you are any better
prepared when you know your child might
die because mine was taken instantly
i don't think you could ever be prepared
for the final words no matter what the
circumstance
her death set me back for a few days and
then i got better
i let this girl go by telling scotty to
meet her and help her
i got to thinking is everyone going to
the other side
since scotty's death a young boy in our
neighborhood died and my daughter's
cousin died in texas
it caused me to think they're all
together
in the beginning i always imagined
scotty was somewhere alone he's not
alone
there are more than there are here
my older daughter miranda was in a bad
accident in june 1999
she was in surgery for about six hours i
was so scared
i prayed and asked god to please not
make me go through this again
she has two children i also prayed for
the strength to survive the pain if she
didn't make it
she survived and i thanked god she has a
six inch scar on her face but that isn't
important
she is still here maybe i haven't given
god enough credit to my story
i was so mad at god for taking scotty
one minute and begging for his help
constantly
saying the lord's prayer and repeating
psalm 23 helped me so very much
i have faith that god will help me he
can be dependent upon
sometimes things happen to us so we
don't want to happen but when they do
god will help us through the trial there
is one thing you have to do though
you must ask him for help there are some
things i just have to turn over to him
religion when scotty died i had many
visitors representing several different
religions
i had always been a southern baptist
members of the church of latter-day
saints visited me
the young boys came to my house and
called me regularly i learned a great
deal about their religion
i knew very little about their religion
before friends who were jehovah
witnesses visited me
they were supportive i talked with
baptist methodists catholics
presbyterians
probably some of the other religions i
can't remember i felt they were all
sincere in trying to help me and i thank
them all
i don't think i'm of any particular
religion but i can tell you i am a
believer
many churches sent letters to me they
had special prayers for me so many
people signed the letter
i needed all the prayers i could get and
they were answered god did help me
scotty didn't come back but god helped
me live with my lost
the comfort zone finding a comfort zone
is a huge step in your recovery from
grief
you are getting out of the maze you
finally find comfort in something
anything that makes you feel safe
my comfort zone became my bedroom i
would go in there alone and turn the
television on to the lifetime channel
i would lose myself in one of the movies
i would stare at the television and
concentrate entirely on the movie
it was a fantasy or maybe it took me
away for a little while
it became a little vacation from the
grief it may sound strange but find the
comfort zone no matter what it is was
such a relief it does bring comfort at
least for a while
i found that physical activity served as
another release from grief a good friend
of mine
was asked if she would clean an office
building about eight miles from my house
she asked my daughter to help i went
along with him to help too
i discovered that i loved going to this
cleaning job i don't think they realized
what it was doing for me
as soon as i got home from my full-time
job we went to this office to clean
there was nothing physical about my
full-time job but the clean job was all
physical
the more i moved the better i felt i
would think of things that we could do
to make it cleaner
we are still cleaning this office and
still feels good
one thing that helps is that people that
work there are good to us and appreciate
us before scottie died i had been
walking at night i started walking again
and i started up
stared up at the sky a lot begging
scotty to appear
the walking really helped to make me
feel better at first i didn't have the
strength to walk very far but again to
regain my endurance
i remember the first time i made a joke
and laughed it felt so natural at first
i sounded like i used to it startled me
afterwards i thought
how can i laugh scotty is dead i soon
realized i was getting me back and i had
missed myself for so long
i wasn't hurting scotty by not
constantly crying scotty would be proud
of me
he never ever wanted me to spend the
rest of my life grieving his death
he loves me and i love him if you begin
to wonder whether your children knew how
much you love them if they loved you
sit down and tell them now i did
i apologized for anything i ever did
that may have hurt him
make peace with that person i believe
they will hear you
i also forgave scotty for all the nights
i worried about him
i forgave him for the time he got into
trouble then i forgave him for being so
tired that night he went to sleep and
lost his life and hurt me so deeply
i know he didn't mean to i thank god we
had 25 years together
i'm thankful scotty grew into a fine man
i should have mentioned this before i
should have mentioned on every page of
this book but i will say it now
always even in the shock i thank god
that scotty did not take anyone else's
life when he fell asleep in the car
and he drifted across the meeting into
the tree
one of my friends gave me a book life is
hello
life is goodbye by allah campbell about
a year after scottie died
this book has the best explanation of
grief of anything i've ever read
i wish i had known of it in the
beginning i have about 75 post-it notes
in this one book
this book told me everything i have been
through was normal i encourage every
dreaming parent to get this book
since reading i purchased several copies
to give it to newly bereaved parents
i also found comfort in humming the song
me and god are watching scotty grow
i named scotty from the song by bobby
goldsboro
conclusion i'm watching my
seven-year-old grandson playing little
league baseball
he's a big boy he's a good hitter i
think of my little seven-year-old boy he
was so tiny he could hardly hold the bat
they called him strikeout scotty one
time he caught a fly ball and everyone
in the stand stood up and cheered
he wasn't a good baseball player either
as i sit here now i wonder did i want
him to play or did he want to play
when this game is over i'm going to ask
my grandson if he wants to play
i want him to play because he wants to
not because we signed him up to play
he loves basketball and he doesn't
really care for baseball
i told him that's okay to have the
courage to quit that is how i look at
things now
we are going home now and i do ask
carrie he says he wants to finish this
year of baseball
and then he will be old enough to play
basketball i ask do you really love
basketball
he says he does i respond well that's
good and i want you always to be able to
tell me things you like
not what i like he just grins with his
scotty grin says okay mama
carrie looks so much like scottie lots
of people say my goodness carries just
like scotty
you have scotty through kerry but i
don't scottie was his own individual
person
carrie is my daughter's child and his
own person i just want to be his
grandmother
my daughters have accepted scottie's
death i think that when i started
getting better they did too
we are all different because of our loss
we don't take so much for granted
anymore
we know how quickly your entire world
can change
i am hoping now to start a grief center
i have thought about it for such a very
long time
i want a white house with an arc way to
walk through i want that archway to look
like the bright light of my experience
i want the visitors to feel free to say
anything they feel they need to get out
of their minds i want to help them
i want to tell them how the dagger will
work through their body and the mind but
they will get better
the pain one feels does not last forever
this is very hard to believe in the
beginning i would never have believed
the pain would lessen
i am functioning now as i did before
scotty died i am laughing
loving and living no it did not take
four years to get to this point
i don't think there's anything a parent
could do for just one minute one hug
a chance to say i love you or a chance
to say goodbye
it's not goodbye but i will be with you
again and this time will be forever
now god is watching scotty grow
the following short stories are
unexplained happenings were they
messages
i like to think so the card the first
mother's day card was terrible
he should be here or call me i sunk so
very low that day
but then i went to my bedroom and
started going through various cards i
had saved
there was a card it was sealed i assumed
it resealed itself i off after i opened
it last year
i can honestly say that i never remember
seeing the card sign scotty
the s was made in a little duck like i
taught him when he was a little boy
i was so happy to see the card last
mother's day scottie and stacy had
bought me a beautiful id
silver bracelet i had seen the bracelet
the jewelry store where stacy worked
i was waiting for it to go on sale i
remember when scotty brought it to me
i was so surprised and put it right on
my arm he joked now mama
if you forget your name just look at
your bracelet i don't know for sure but
i wonder if the card got inside and i
never opened it
i felt guilty if i had not opened the
card but opening now is like hearing
from scotty
i thought the card was so unusual
because it said thanks for putting up
with me and he was eternally grateful
the card made me feel a little better
dimes it was during the first couple of
weeks after scottie died i was getting
out of bed i noticed a bright shiny dime
on the floor by my bed
i picked it up and for some reason i
felt it was there for me
i found the dimes by my bed two more
times i can't say that they'd
fall out of clothes but each time it was
dimes i associate scotty with dimes from
then on
every time i found a dime anywhere i
felt good my friends would always
respect the dime fines
i bought a new car four months ago i
only looked at one car when i opened the
door
dime was laying on the floorboard i
bought the car
it may be a lemon but so far it's been
great if it is a lemon maybe he's
laughing because of all the lemons i
bought him
little violet flowers scotty loved
easter
he liked to hide and hunt the eggs he
also liked to throw eggs at his sisters
one of the best videos i have was scotty
is one who was hunting eggs when he was
23 years old
the last easter he was here he was not
able to come easter day but he came by
work after and asked
where's my easter basket when easter
came i wanted to get scotty some little
silk violet colored wildflowers like he
used to pick for me when his little boy
my daughter and i looked everywhere we
could not find the violet flowers
for some reason i associated dogwood
with scotty
we took the dogwood to the graveyard and
there in the middle of his grave grew
one bunch of eyelid flowers
we stood there speechless i said well i
guess he found his own
my friend says i think they are for you
we walked over the entire graveyard
there were violet flowers in the woods
by the graveyard but only scotty had the
wild violet flowers on his grave
it's been four and a half years and i
still have the flowers
when i went to the sea rosemary lt in
new york she had a bouquet of little
violet flowers just like the ones i was
looking for
i didn't ask her but i often wondered
why she held these flowers almost all
day
did he know the week before scottie died
he did something totally out of his
character
he rarely bought clothes he always
waited for his wife or me to buy them
he didn't like to spend money on clothes
that week he went on a shopping spree
and bought himself some beautiful
clothes
to our amazement he took stacey on a
trip to new orleans
we often wondered why he was so
different the week before his death
christmas light three years after
scottie died we were opening christmas
gifts at my home
everyone was opening gifts and the noise
level was pretty loud
my three-year-old grandson stopped
opening gifts and said
look at the light we all stopped and
looked toward the ceiling where he
stared
we saw nothing he pointed turning his
head following the light all around the
room
we asked him what light he was becoming
agitated because
we could not see the light i've always
heard small innocent children are
closest to the spiritual world
end of chapter in the book
